fr.upmc.components.cvm

Class AbstractCVM

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.upmc.components.cvm.AbstractCVM
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentVirtualMachineI
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractDistributedCVM, CVM, CVM, CVM, CVM, CVM, DynamicCVM, SmoothingCVM

    public abstract class AbstractCVM
extends java.lang.Object
implements ComponentVirtualMachineI
    The class AbstractCVM defines the common properties of component virtual machines in the component model.

    Description

    Local CVM are deployed on a single Java virtual machine and have local component interconnections only. A CVM must define a deploy method that includes all the code necessary to instantiate and interconnect the static components in the application. Then, they must define a start method that plays the role of a main method in object-oriented Java applications.

    Usage

    Local CVM are defined as subclasses of this abstract class. A CVM has to redefine deploy and may redefine start. The method start defined here defaults to starting all of the components registered as deployed on this site by calling the method addDeployedComponent. Every port that will be used to connect components must be published in the local registry by calling the method localPublishPort and it can be unpublished by calling the method localUnpublishPort.

    Invariant

     invariant      this.componentRegistry != null

    Created on : 2011-11-18

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean DEBUG
      Enables or not debugging messages.
      protected java.util.Vector<ComponentI> deployedComponents
      collection of deployed components.
      protected boolean deploymentDone
      true if the deployment is completed and false otherwise.
      static java.lang.String DYNAMIC_COMPONENT_CREATOR_INBOUNDPORT_URI
      suffix for the dynamic component creator component inbound port URI.
      static boolean isDistributed
      true if the CVM currently running is distributed.
      protected static java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,PortI> LOCAL_REGISTRY
      local registry linking port URI to local port objects.
      protected static int LOCAL_REGISTRY_INIT_SIZE
      initial number of potential entries in the local registry.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractCVM()
      create and initialise a local CVM.
      AbstractCVM(boolean isDistributed)
      create and initialise the CVM, tagged as distributed if the parameter is true, and as local otherwise; note however that distributed CVM must be created as subclasses of the class AbstractDistributedCVM, so this constructor should never be called directly but only through the other constructor of this class or through one of the constructors of AbstractDistributedCVM.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addDeployedComponent(ComponentI component)
      add a component to the set of deployed components on the CVM.
      boolean awaitTermination(long timeout, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      wait for the termination of the CVM (i.e. all of the locally deployed components in the CVM); inspired from the Java Executor framework.
      void deploy()
      simply set the deploymentDone flag to true, so it should be called at the end of the user's own deploy method.
      protected static void initialiseConnectionBuilder()
      initialise the static variable SINGLETON of the class ConnectionBuilder to the sole instance of this class that is required and used in the current JVM.
      boolean isDeployedComponent(ComponentI component)
      tests if a component is in the set of deployed components on the CVM.
      boolean isShutdown()
      check if the CVM has been shut down (i.e. all of the locally deployed components in the CVM); inspired from the Java Executor framework.
      boolean isTerminated()
      check if the CVM has terminated (i.e. all of the locally deployed components in the CVM); inspired from the Java Executor framework.
      static void localPublishPort(PortI port)
      publish the port in the local registry.
      static void localUnpublishPort(PortI port)
      unpublish the port in the local registry.
      void removeDeployedComponent(ComponentI component)
      remove a component from the set of deployed components on the CVM.
      void shutdown()
      shut down the CVM, synchronising with the other JVM when distributed, i.e. all of the deployed components in the CVM are shut down; inspired from the Java Executor framework.
      void shutdownNow()
      shut down the CVM now, synchronising with the other sites when distributed, i.e. all of the locally deployed components in the CVM are shut down; inspired from the Java Executor framework.
      void start()
      check if the deployment is completed, and start all of the deployed components.

      • awaitTermination

        public boolean awaitTermination(long timeout,
                       java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
                         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: ComponentVirtualMachineI
        wait for the termination of the CVM (i.e. all of the locally deployed components in the CVM); inspired from the Java Executor framework.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        awaitTermination in interface ComponentVirtualMachineI
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum time to wait.
        unit - the time unit of the timeout argument.
        Returns:
        true if this executor terminated and false if the timeout elapsed before termination.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting.
        See Also:
        ComponentVirtualMachineI.awaitTermination(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit)
